intro: Uragoga cujabensis, commonly known as the Cuja bush, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of northern South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are usually pink or purple. Uragoga cujabensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
